before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3psnn","text":"Do aliquots of 1 mL of sterile milliQ water.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9d23","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38itu","text":"Before starting, place all the supplies and sterile milliQ Water needed for the PCR under the PCR hood and switch on the UV light for at least 20 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"esjmp","text":"Nowadays metabarcoding approaches allow to explore the diversity of different communities using next-generation sequencing (NGS).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6evot","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ags01","text":"Here we describe the 18S-V4 DNA amplification method applied for eukaryote metabarcoding analyses using Illumina Miseq technology. This protocol has been used in many projects studying eukaryotic diversity (TARA-OCEANS 2009-2013, TARA-PACIFIC 2016-2018), and eukaryote monitoring projects (MOOSE-GE 2017-..., ROSCOFF ASTAN 2009-ongoing).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep0n5","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el4ae","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9vjf","text":"We developed the flowchart for 2 different sequencing platforms : Fasteris-Gene Support SA (Plan-Les-Ouates, Swiss) and GeT-PlaGE (Toulouse, France).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hq07","text":"PCR reactions are performed using the Taq polymerase Phusion High-Fidelity Master Mix with GC buffer (Thermofisher, Cat No F-532 L).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":78}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bblb","text":"This Taq  has a good proof-reading and its buffer allows amplification of high GC templates.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71dgf","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eddoi","text":"Keep the same annealing temperature as the one is used with the usual 18S-V4 primer set.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2kks","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn9t2","text":"First test each of your taggeg-primer sets on a positive and a negative control following steps 5, 6, 7 and 8.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23v1s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hihj","text":"Then you can perform DNA sample amplification following next steps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gjpc","text":"PCR Programm :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5scjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"appaf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a94u2","text":"In order to reduce the artificial building of chimeras during the PCR process, you should reduce the # of cycles to a minimum : 20, 25, max 30 (chimerization occurs principally during the plateau-phase of the PCR reaction).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tn1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F33F4AD0409C11EC8A5EC92419371A7B","height":247,"id":208697,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"18S-V4 PCR programm.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fwab9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm339ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm329ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi63k","text":"Mix 1 vol of sample with 2 volumes of buffer NT.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41nr8","text":"Follow the instructions of manufacturer (mentioned in the Step 9), except for the elution step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90k2g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"296is","text":"Elution Step : ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"406hh","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"725mb","text":"- Place the NucleoSpin PCR Clean-Up Column into a clean 1.5mL microtube correctly labeled (sample, target tagged-MID, date).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jabd","text":"- Add 22 µL buffer NE preheated at 65°C directly onto the column and incubate 5 min @ 65°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2dap","text":"- Centrifuge 1 min @ 11 000 g.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uds6","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1s8b","text":"Store the purified PCR products at -20°C or directly do the quantification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8m104","text":"PCR products are quantified using the quantification kit: Quant-iT™ PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent *2000 assays* (Invitrogen, cat nb P7581) and a Fluorometer Plate readerFluorometer Plate reader, following the manufacturer's protocol.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ur2m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9513m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"firrc","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"61rj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"B6B8E42040A311EC8A5EC92419371A7B","id":184342,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Quant-it Picogreen dsDNA kit.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fway9ufn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g1hn","text":"After quantification of the PCR products, amplicons will be pooled before shipment to  the NGS Fasteris sequencing platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi34g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jac1","text":"One final tube (called \"Pooled Amplicons\") will contain all pooled amplicons at equimolar concentration, ready for the library preparation. The amounts and volume required by Fasteris are : 1μg of equimolar amplicon pool in 30 μl (so Pool Amplicons concentration should be \u003e35 ng/µL) .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":190,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvm9b","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr9uk","text":"The volume of each amplicon that will added in the tube \"Pooled Amplicons\" is calculated based on their average concentration as follows :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pg2c","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oe9u","text":"Calculation table for Pool Amplicons preparation :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnpv1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55dgd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f67je","text":"If the final volume of Pooled Amplicons is higher than 30 µL, (so concentration inferior to 35ng/µL), an additionnal concentration step will be necessary. For this we used the purification kit: NucleoSpin® PCR Clean-Up (Macherey-Nagel, cat. nb 740609.50 or 740609.250 ).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":194,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahq2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98hh3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E3297B4040A911EC8A5EC92419371A7B","height":269,"id":208705,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Pool amplicons_annotated.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fwba9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm4b9ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm4a9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"anp05","text":"Amplicons from each DNA sample are all pooled in a single microtube. Each pool of amplicons will be considered as a \"library sample \" or called \"Pooled Amplicons\" and loaded on a Miseq run.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":145,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k04j","text":"\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hk2","text":"To allow the latter separation of each sample in the Pooled Amplicon sample, each DNA is amplified using forward tagged primer built with a structure 5'-NNNN-MID-forwardprimer'. The reverse primer is not modified.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs9lb","text":"\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et02f","text":"The tag, or Multiplex IDentifier (MID) is a unique short sequence of 7 or 8 bases compatible with the forward primer V4f and generated using the matrix oligoTag program (Coissac et al. 2012). We also added 4 N at the 5' extremity of the forward primer to help MID sequence conservation during the cluster synthesis step on the {"blocks":[{"key":"9bhj5","text":"Prepare the Master Mix :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lb7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9is10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"davt1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7atv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D083A7C04DF811EC9A8599B155694ECE","height":245,"id":208735,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"PCR mix_Phusion.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm5b9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm499ufn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm5a9ufn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm489ufn.webp","width":430}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l2fr","text":"Dispence 24 µL of each tagged-MID-primer - PCR mix preparation per well under the PCR hood, and then add 1 (5ng) µL of template on the bench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"pb63","text":"Prepare 1,2 % agarose  gel in TAE 0.5x buffer  :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mr85","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bbhk","text":"- In a Becher, put 1.2g agarose (Interchim, ref 31272L ) in 100mL TAE 0.5x buffer (TAE prediluted in milliQ water from TAE 10x-Thermofisher Scientific, ref 15558042).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2kea","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qs31","text":"- Heat under total dissolution of the agarose powder (you can use a microwave or a stirer plate).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lgin","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb4oh","text":"- Add one drop of Ethidium Bromide (Eurobio, ref GEPBET02AF).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c31p","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tch1","text":"- Prepare casting tray with combs according to your number of PCR products to check. (Biorad, ref 1704484)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aff9o","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k74f","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8350s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aprnf","text":"- Poor gel in the casting tray and check there are no bubbles.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9rgk","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91mvn","text":"- Let solidify for 20 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"8D55C5D44DF911ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":186475,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Biorad_Gel Caster.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fydm9ufn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7lju","text":"Sample loading and electrophoresis conditions :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sm1m","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36f22","text":"Prepare  the loading samples :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qij8","text":"In a semi-skirted 96-wells PCR plate (like AB-0900 PCR plate), mix 5µL of each sample with 1µL of loading buffer 6x (Thermofisher Scientific, ref R0611). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2s7e","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lo23","text":"Place solidified gel in the proper orientation (electrophoresis occurs from cathode to anode).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31a8q","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8um9d","text":"Load :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dou76","text":"- PCR products : 6µL ;","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rad1","text":"- Smartladder 200 to 10 000 bp : 3µL ; (Eurogentec, ref MW-1700-10).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3g64","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epj3f","text":"Close the caster and connect it to the generator ( Bio-Rad, ref 1645050).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rb0c","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u3a8","text":"Let run the electrophoresis at 110 V for 45 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
